p.s: Shakespeare's works are still topics in school and inspiration to many creative renewals in form of movies or plays.
But is his work still relevant today or rather outdated?
One could argue taht those problems presented dont occur in modern days.
Prearranged marriage is a thing of the past and nowadays women can decide for themselves whom to marry.
The counter side might argue that nowadays people struggle with their individual situations and their love more than ever.
Nowadays people have more personal goals and are trying to accomplish them by any means in the modern self-fixiatedself-fixated world.
And to combine personal life with new love can be challenging, as it is also portrayed in the play by Shakespeare.
On the counter side his work Romeo and Juliet is not so different than other love stories and thus due to the old language outdated.
The only difference, one might say, is the language compared to newer romantic dramas and the plot mostly stays the same.
CritiquesCritics may respond that the language is the key aspect, when reading old literature.
Shakespeare's poetic and lyrical writing style described the storyboard in a way that modern language is not capable of.

All in all the stated facts lead me to my opinion, which is that Shakespeare still influences modern literature and can be interpreted on the world today regarding timeless themes such as love being connected to irrationality or boundaries like different families / religion / hirarchyhierarchy being in the way of love.
